db:abstract.db:para: The PlaceAttribute type holds generic place attribute information.
This type was introduced in Qt Location 5.5.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A place attribute stores an additional piece of information about a Place that is not otherwise exposed through the Place type. A PlaceAttribute is a textual piece of data, accessible through the text property, and a label. Both the text and label properties are intended to be displayed to the user. PlaceAttributes are stored in an ExtendedAttributes map with a unique key.
The following example shows how to display all attributes in a list:
The following example shows how to assign and modify an attribute:

db:section.db:title: attribute : QPlaceAttribute
db:section.db:para: For details on how to use this property to interface between C++ and QML see "Interfaces between C++ and QML Code".

db:section.db:title: label : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the attribute label which is a user visible string describing the attribute.

db:section.db:title: text : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the attribute text which can be used to show additional information about the place.
